Recommendations received Nicholas Ricco ‚Äú Dr Costas Tsatsoulis is a unique academic with applied insights to peripheral concepts available to but under utilized by most his peers. He takes his obligations for student academic enhancements to their zenith thereby creating THE BEGINNING of intellectualism at UNT which has been none existent in the 55 years I have been associated with this School. They are about 125 years behind in enhancement of intellectual thought processes. Debates are none existent, other than for competition; Ethics discussions misdirected or worse, permitted at grade school level! Costas Tsatsoulis is the only Dean who reviewed ethical discussions by students and refused to submit student sub par discussions for financial awards! ‚Äù 1 person has recommended Costas Join now to view More activity by Costas On July 10th, S&T's Rocket Design Team successfully launched Killer Queen Remastered up to a height of 12,080 feet! The hybrid-format program, led by Kara Weatherman, will combine hands-on lab training and a required in-person capstone. Through a valued partnership with SpectronRx, Purdue will also establish a dedicated training facility in Indianapolis to support student learning and industry collaboration. This program reflects Purdue‚Äôs commitment to working with Indianapolis-based partners to provide real-world experiences and advanced training ‚Äî equipping graduates for a wide range of careers across pharmacy, chemistry, engineering, physics, health care, and more. It's a meaningful step forward in strengthening the talent pipeline for this critical and fast-evolving sector in Indianapolis and across the State of Indiana. https://lnkd.in/g2JnXTSP 167 10 Comments Purdue Polytechnic Purdue Polytechnic professor leads team awarded nearly $2 million NSF grant to bring microelectronics into K-12 classrooms.
